Utterance: Hi, it's good to see you again! How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’m feeling pretty good. I’ve been working on my resume and applying for more jobs.
That’s great to hear! Have you had any responses or interviews yet?
A couple of places reached out, but I haven’t had any interviews yet. Just trying to stay positive.
Staying positive is very important. Can you tell me about how you’re managing your feelings of anticipation or anxiety while waiting for responses?
Well, I try to keep myself busy. I write poetry and listen to music. I’ve also been going for walks in the park.
That sounds like a healthy way to cope. How does walking in the park make you feel?
It helps clear my mind. I feel more relaxed when I’m surrounded by nature. It’s peaceful.
Peaceful is a good feeling. Have you noticed any changes in your mood during these walks?
Yes! I feel lighter, like I can let go of some stress. I think being outside really helps.
That’s wonderful. It sounds like you’re finding effective ways to manage stress. Have you experienced any challenges lately that you want to discuss?
Well, I had a moment last week when I felt really overwhelmed. I was thinking about my son again and it just hit me hard.
I understand. It’s natural for those feelings to resurface. Can you describe what happened during that moment?
I was sitting in my room, and I just started thinking about how long it’s been since I last saw him. I felt a wave of sadness wash over me.
That sounds really tough. How did you cope with those feelings when they came up?
I ended up writing a poem about it. It helped me express what I was feeling instead of bottling it up.
Writing can be a powerful outlet for emotions. What was the poem about?
It was about longing and hope. I wrote about the memories I have of him and how I’m waiting for the day we can see each other again.
That’s beautiful. It sounds like you’re channeling your feelings into something creative. Do you find that writing helps you process your emotions?
Definitely. It’s like therapy for me. I can get everything out on paper and then feel lighter afterward.
I’m glad to hear that. It’s important to have those outlets. As you think about your son, what are some positive memories that come to mind?
I remember taking him to the park when he was little. We’d play on the swings and laugh together. Those moments were special.
Those are precious memories. It sounds like you had a strong bond. How do you feel when you reflect on those times?
I feel a mix of happiness and sadness. Happy for the memories but sad that I can’t create new ones right now.
That’s understandable. It’s okay to feel both emotions at the same time. Have you thought about ways to keep that connection alive, even from a distance?
I’ve thought about writing him letters. I could send them to his last known address.
That’s a wonderful idea! Writing letters could be a way to express your feelings and thoughts. Would you feel comfortable doing that?
Yes, I think I would. It might help me feel closer to him, even if he doesn’t receive them right away.
It could be a therapeutic process for you. You’re taking steps to maintain that connection, which is very meaningful.
I hope so. I just want him to know I’m thinking about him.
And that’s important. Let’s also talk about your job search. What kinds of positions are you most interested in?
I’m really focused on finding counseling positions. I want to help people, especially those struggling with addiction.
That aligns with your passion. Have you considered volunteering in the meantime to gain experience?
I haven’t thought about that. Do you think it would help?
Absolutely! Volunteering can provide valuable experience and connections in the field. It might also boost your confidence.
That makes sense. I’ll look into local organizations that could use help.
Great! That could be a productive way to spend your time while job searching.
I like that idea. I’ll start researching this week.
Excellent! And remember to keep an open mind. Sometimes opportunities come from unexpected places.
True! I’ll keep that in mind as I search.
Before we wrap up, is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think I’ve shared everything on my mind. I’m feeling good about the letter idea and volunteering.
I’m glad to hear that. It sounds like you’re taking positive steps forward.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
Of course! I’m here for you. Let’s set a goal for our next session. How about you write a letter to your son before we meet again?
I can do that. I’ll bring it in to share if I feel comfortable.
That sounds perfect. I look forward to hearing about it. Take care, and I’ll see you next time!
See you, Ellie! Thank you!
